definitions.definition: the solid mineral material forming part of the surface of the earth and other similar planets, exposed on the surface or underlying the soil or oceans.
a mass of rock projecting above the earth's surface or out of the sea.
examples: there are dangerous rocks around the island
synonyms: outcrop "a castle built on a rock"

definitions.definition: any natural material, hard or soft (e.g., clay), having a distinctive mineral composition.
Gibraltar.
examples: singular proper noun: Rock; noun: the Rock

definitions.definition: informal name for Newfoundland1.
a large piece of rock that has become detached from a cliff or mountain; a boulder.
examples: the stream flowed through a jumble of rocks

definitions.definition: a stone of any size, especially one small enough to be picked up and used as a projectile.
examples: boulder, stone, pebble a gully strewn with rocks

definitions.definition: a kind of hard confectionery in the form of cylindrical peppermint-flavored sticks.
a precious stone, especially a diamond.
examples: diamond, jewel, precious stone she wore a massive rock on her finger

definitions.definition: a small piece of crack cocaine.
testicles.
used in similes and metaphors to refer to someone or something that is extremely strong, reliable, or hard.
examples: imagining himself as the last rock of civilization being swept over by a wave of barbarism
synonyms: anchor "Toni was the rock on which they relied"

definitions.definition: (especially with allusion to shipwrecks) a source of danger or destruction.
examples: the new system is heading for the rocks

definitions.definition: money.
move gently to and fro or from side to side.
examples: she rocked the baby in her arms
synonyms: oscillate "the ship rocked on the water"

definitions.definition: (with reference to a building or region) shake or cause to shake or vibrate, especially because of an impact, earthquake, or explosion.
examples: another blast rocked the ship and threw him from his chair

definitions.definition: cause great shock or distress to (someone or something), especially so as to weaken or destabilize them or it.
examples: diplomatic upheavals that rocked the British Empire
synonyms: disconcert "Wall Street was rocked by the news"

definitions.definition: dance to or play rock music.
(of a place) have an atmosphere of excitement or much social activity.
wear (a garment) or affect (an attitude or style), especially in a confident or flamboyant way.
examples: she was rocking a clingy little leopard-skin number

definitions.definition: rock music.
rock and roll.
a gentle movement to and fro or from side to side.
examples: she placed the baby in the cradle and gave it a rock
